meta.content: Harvard Public Schools - School Closure Information

School office hours... Monday through Thursday 8am to 3:30pm, Friday 8am to Noon.
Information for School by week...
Due to Governor Ricketts direction, Harvard Public School plans to remain closed through May 31st.
Information for School by week is listed below.

div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 08:53 am CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly between 3pm and 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 76. Southwest wind 5 to 10 mph becoming north in the afternoon. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Mostly clear, with a low around 45. North northeast wind 5 to 10 mph becoming west northwest after midnight.

A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms after 1pm. Increasing clouds, with a high near 75. West northwest wind 5 to 10 mph. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

strong.span: School office hours... Monday through Thursday 8am to 3:30pm, Friday 8am to Noon.

span.i: Due to Governor Ricketts direction, Harvard Public School plans to remain closed through May 31st.

p.span: Information for School by week is listed below.

div.p: Staff Enrichment Activity Preparation/Review (limited staff access to building)

p.i: Re-Evaluation of the closure situation and future plans will be considered on April 16th.

div.p: Staff Enrichment Activity Preparation/Review (limited staff access to building)
Staff Enrichment Activity Preparation/Review (limited staff access to building)
Staff Enrichment Activity Preparation/Review (limited staff access to building)

p.b: Harvard Public School will be offering a school closure meal program for anyone under the age of 19 within our district. Meals will be delivered to the doorstep each day of students choosing to participate. The meal will be delivered M-F between 11:00am and 12:00pm and will include lunch for that day and breakfast for the next morning. This is a free program for anyone under the age of 19. This program will continue until school resumes. or the end of the school year.
p.strong: If you are not participating and would like to participate, please contact the school at 402-772-2171

span.span: Due to recent awareness of infectious diseases, Harvard Public School is providing reliable websites to collect more information for our school community. Here is some health and safety information to inform parents, patrons, and supporters of our district regarding health and safety related to the Coronavirus. We have been working with the Clay County Emergency Manager on details of the situation in the area and are doing what we can to best prevent the spread of any flu throughout our building. Our custodial staff does a tremendous job at keeping our building clean and will be disinfecting even more during this time.
There are links and general information for Coronavirus located on the South Heartland District Health Department website:
If someone in your family is feeling physically or mentally unwell, but you don’t want to go t
o a crowded clinic, call and ask about the availability of
You may be able to see a health provider from home via the internet. Just make sure to check with your insurance provider regarding coverage for these services first.
